00054 /* avoid "Thundering Herd" with retry thread when multiple devices */
00055 #define I2O_RETRY(device)       (1 + HZ/10 + (device)->idx)

00058 static void dumpHrd(const char* name, struct HOST_REQUEST_DATA_RECORD* hrd)
00059 {
00060         dbg(1, "%10s c:%2d %x pci:%08x start:%d n:%d s:%d\n",
00061             name, hrd->chan&0x3f, hrd->chan, hrd->pci, hrd->start, 
00062             hrd->nsamples, hrd->stride );
00063 }
00064 
00065 
00066 #define DUMPHRD(var) dumpHrd(#var, var)
00067 
00068 #define CHAN(file) ((file)->f_dentry->d_inode->i_rdev&0x00ff)
00069 
00070 static Message *build_hrd_message(
00071         struct file *file, 
00072         unsigned pa,
00073         unsigned start,
00074         unsigned length,
00075         unsigned stride,
00076         int outbound,
00077         unsigned short cflags
00078         )
00079 {
00080         Message *message = (Message*)LBUF(file);
00081         switch(outbound){
00082         default:
00083         case 0:
00084                 message->header.type = outbound;
00085                 break;
00086         case 1:
00087         case -1:
00088                 message->header.type = 
00089                         MAKE_MT_COMMAND(outbound>0?
00090                                         MTC_HOST_REQUEST_DATA_ACQBOUND:
00091                                         MTC_HOST_REQUEST_DATA_HOSTBOUND);
00092         }
00093         message->header.length = 2*HRDR_SZ;
00094 
00095         message->payload.hrdr[0].pci = pa;
00096         message->payload.hrdr[0].start = start;
00097         message->payload.hrdr[0].nsamples = length;
00098         message->payload.hrdr[0].stride = stride;
00099         message->payload.hrdr[0].chan = CHAN(file)|cflags;
00100         
00101         memset( &message->payload.hrdr[1], 0, HRDR_SZ);
00102 
00103         PD(file)->last_direction_hack = outbound;
00104 
00105         dbg(1, "pci %08x nsamples %d chan %x ob:%d",
00106                 message->payload.hrdr[0].pci,
00107                 message->payload.hrdr[0].nsamples,
00108                 message->payload.hrdr[0].chan,
00109                 outbound);
00110 
00111         return message;
00112 }
00113 
00114 static Message *build_outgoing_raw_message(
00115         struct file *file, 
00116         unsigned pa,
00117         unsigned start_byte,
00118         unsigned nbytes,
00119         unsigned short cflags
00120         )
00121 {
00122         return build_hrd_message(
00123                 file, pa, start_byte/2, nbytes/2, 1, LDH_OUTBOUND, cflags);
00124 }
00125 
00126 static Message *build_incoming_raw_message(
00127         struct file *file, 
00128         unsigned pa,
00129         unsigned start_byte,
00130         unsigned nbytes,
00131         unsigned short cflags
00132         )
00133 {
00134         return build_hrd_message(
00135                 file, pa, start_byte/2, nbytes/2, 1, LDH_INBOUND, cflags);
00136 }

00138 
00139 static void buildRch(
00140         struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch,
00141         void (*handler)( 
00142                 struct ReturnCommandHandler* this, 
00143                 struct MESSAGE* messsage ),
00144         struct Acq200Path *path,
00145         struct IoMapping *kbuf,
00146         unsigned flags)
00147 {
00148         rch->handler = handler;
00149         rch->path = path;
00150         rch->device = path->device;
00151         rch->command_id = MAKE_ID_DTACQ(path->device->m_dpd.i2o_last_id_out+1);
00152         rch->rchReturn.valid = 0;
00153         rch->rchReturn.nbytes = 0;
00154         rch->rchReturn.kbuf = kbuf;
00155         rch->rchReturn.flags = flags;
00156         rch->lock = &path->device->m_dpd.rch.lock;
00157 }
00158 
00159 #define MFA_MASK 0x00ffffff
00160 
00161 int acq200_sendI2O_kbuf( struct Acq200Path* path, Message* message )
00162 {
00163         struct Acq200Device* device = path->device;
00164         unsigned mfa = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_IQP));
00165 
00166     
00167         if (mfa == PCI_I2O_INVALID_MFA){
00168                 dbg(1, "ERROR: no i2o buffers available" );
00169                 return -EACQ32_NO_INCOMING_I2O;
00170         }else{
00171                 char* pdst = (char*)device->ram.va + (mfa&=MFA_MASK);
00172 
00173                 dbg(2,  "write Message %d to mfa 0x%08x\n", 
00174                     path->device->m_dpd.i2o_last_id_out+1, mfa );
00175           
00176                 message->header.id =
00177                         MAKE_ID_DTACQ(++device->m_dpd.i2o_last_id_out);
00178 
00179                 dbg(3, "message %4d %d 0x%08x 0x%04x 0x%04x\n",
00180                     message->header.id, 
00181                     message->header.length,
00182                     message->header.type,
00183                     message->payload.sdata[0], 
00184                     message->payload.sdata[1] );
00185 
00186                 dbg(3, "memcpy( %p %p %ld )", pdst, message,
00187                     (unsigned long)sizeof(MessageHeader)+message->header.length);       
00188 
00189                 memcpy(pdst, message, MESSAGE_ACTUAL_LEN(message));
00190 
00191                 dma_sync_single(
00192                         &device->pci_dev->dev, device->ram.pa + mfa, 
00193                         MESSAGE_ACTUAL_LEN(message), 
00194                         DMA_TO_DEVICE);
00195 
00196                 dbg(3, "writeln(mfa, CSR( device, ACQ200_IQP) 0x%08x",
00197                     mfa);
00198                 writel(mfa, CSR(device, ACQ200_IQP));
00199         
00200                 device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_outgoing++;
00201 
00202                 dbg(3, "return 0");
00203                 return 0;
00204         }
00205 }

00210 /*
00211  * WORKTODO: hopefully we DO NOT have to run this thru
00212  * a local kbuf.
00213  * if so, copy from user to LBUF, LBUF to io in 2K chunks
00214  */
00215 int acq200_copy_from_io_to_user(
00216         struct file *file, void *ubuf, const void *iobuf, int count )
00217 {
00218 #ifdef DOUBLE_TROUBLE
00219         const char* src = iobuf;
00220         char* dst = ubuf;
00221         char* tmp = LBUF(file);
00222         int rv = count;
00223         int ncopy;
00224 
00225         while( count > 0 ){
00226                 ncopy = min(count, LBUFLEN);
00227                 memcpy_fromio(tmp, src, ncopy);
00228                 copy_to_user(dst, tmp, ncopy);
00229                 src += ncopy;
00230                 dst += ncopy;
00231                 count -= ncopy;
00232         }
00233         
00234         return rv;
00235 #else
00236         dbg(1, "copy_to_user(%p, %p, %d)", ubuf, iobuf, count);
00237         if (acq200_stub_copy_to_user){
00238                 return 0;
00239         }
00240 
00241         return copy_to_user(ubuf, iobuf, count);
00242 #endif
00243 }
00244 
00245 int acq200_copy_from_user_to_io(
00246         struct file *file, void *iobuf, const void *ubuf, int count )
00247 {
00248 #ifdef DOUBLE_TROUBLE
00249         const char* src = ubuf;
00250         char* dst = iobuf;
00251         char* tmp = LBUF(file);
00252         int rv = count;
00253         int ncopy;
00254 
00255         while( count > 0 ){
00256                 ncopy = min(count, LBUFLEN);
00257                 copy_from_user(tmp, src, ncopy);
00258                 memcpy_toio(dst, tmp, ncopy);
00259                 src += ncopy;
00260                 dst += ncopy;
00261                 count -= ncopy;
00262         }
00263         return rv;
00264 #else
00265         dbg(1, "copy_from_user( %p %p %d", iobuf, ubuf, count);
00266         return copy_from_user(iobuf, ubuf, count);
00267 #endif
00268 }

00270 
00271 static void i2o_recycleRch(struct ReturnCommandHandler* self)
00272 {
00273 
00274         dbg(2, "self %p self->path %p self->rchReturn.kbuf %p",
00275             self, self->path, self->rchReturn.kbuf);
00276 
00277         if (self->path != 0){
00278                 rchRemove(self);
00279         }
00280         if (self->rchReturn.kbuf && (self->rchReturn.flags&RCH_KB_POOL)){
00281                 acq200_pool_free_mapping(self->device, self->rchReturn.kbuf);
00282         }
00283         acq200_pool_free_rch(self->device, self);
00284         dbg(2, "99");
00285 }
00286 
00287 static void i2o_recycleRchWrapper(
00288         struct ReturnCommandHandler* self,
00289         struct MESSAGE *unused)
00290 {
00291         i2o_recycleRch(self);   
00292 }

00294 
00295 static void i2o_handleReadMessageFile(
00296         struct ReturnCommandHandler* self,
00297         struct MESSAGE* response
00298         )
00299 /* output nsamples as self->clidata in BYTES WORKTODO - is this a good idea? */
00300 {
00301         int nsamples = response->payload.hrdr[0].nsamples;
00302         struct Acq200Path* path = rchSetSamplesAndGetPath(
00303                         self, response->payload.hrdr[0].start, nsamples);
00304 
00305         DUMPHRD(response->payload.hrdr);
00306         dbg(2, "nsamples %d path %p %s\n", 
00307             nsamples, path, path==0? "RECYCLE": "WAKEUP");
00308 
00309         dbg(1, "rch %p valid %d", self, self->rchReturn.valid);
00310         if (path != 0){
00311                 wake_up_interruptible(&path->return_waitq);
00312         }else{
00313                 i2o_recycleRch(self);
00314         }
00315 }

00318 static void acq200_dev_i2o_return_mfa(
00319         struct Acq200Device* device, unsigned mfa)
00320 {
00321         dbg(1,"mfa %08x", mfa);
00322         writel(mfa, CSR(device, ACQ200_OQP));
00323 }
00324 
00325 static void* acq200_dev_i2o_mfa2va(struct Acq200Device *device, u32 mfa)
00326 {
00327         return (void*)(unsigned long)device->dma_buf.va+(mfa&ACQ200_PCIWINMSK);
00328 }

00331 
00332 static int i2o_return_message(struct Acq200Device* device, unsigned mfa)
00333 {
00334         acq200_dev_i2o_return_mfa(device, mfa);
00335         device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_returned++;       
00336         return 0;
00337 }
00338 
00339 #ifdef PGMCOMOUT   // enable for strict mfa checking
00340 #define i2o_return_message( device, mfa )                               \
00341         duff_mfa( device, mfa, "ret" ) || i2o_return_message( device, mfa )
00342 #endif
00343 
00344 /*
00345  * Bottom Halves - ISR task level processing
00346  */
00347 
00348 static void acq200_processCommandMessageReturn(
00349         struct Acq200Device* device,
00350         Message* message
00351         )
00352 // called at bh (ISR-TASK) priority - make it quick
00353 {
00354         struct ReturnCommandHandler* rch;
00355 
00356         dbg(2,   " locating handler for id %d\n", message->header.id );
00357 
00358         list_for_each_entry(rch, &device->m_dpd.rch.list, list){
00359 
00360                 dbg(2, "rch id %d kbuf %p",
00361                     rch->command_id, rch->rchReturn.kbuf);
00362 
00363                 if (rch->command_id == message->header.id){
00364                         if (rch->handler){
00365 
00366                                 dbg(2, "calling handler for id %d", 
00367                                         message->header.id );
00368 
00369                                 rch->handler( rch, message );
00370         
00371                         }else{
00372                                 dbg(2, "NO HANDLER for %d", 
00373                                         message->header.id );
00374                                 i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00375                                 device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_discarded++;
00376                         }
00377 
00378                         return;
00379                 }
00380         }
00381 
00382 /*
00383  * here if not taken by any handler ...
00384  */
00385 
00386         dbg(1,   "ERROR - no handler available, discard\n" );
00387 }
00388 
00389 
00390 
00391 void acq200_streaming_isr_bh(unsigned long clidata)
00392 // check the message and distribute to interested parties
00393 // ideally we would have multiple buffers WORKTODO
00394 {
00395         struct Acq200Device* device = (struct Acq200Device*)clidata;
00396         u32 mfa;
00397 
00398         TIMESTAMP( device, 'i', "bh" );
00399 
00400         dbg(4, "entry\n" );
00401     
00402         while ((mfa = streamGet( &device->streambuf )) != STREAM_MFA_INVALID){
00403                 Message *message = 
00404                         (Message*)acq200_dev_i2o_mfa2va(device, mfa);
00405 
00406                 dbg(2,   " mfa 0x%08x type 0x%08x id %04d len %d\n", 
00407                     mfa, MT_ID(message->header.type), 
00408                     message->header.id,
00409                     message->header.length);
00410 
00411                 if ( acq200_debug ==7 ){
00412                         dbg(2, "SHORT CIRCUIT\n" );
00413                         i2o_return_message( device, mfa );
00414                         continue;
00415                 }
00416 
00417                 switch( MT_ID(message->header.type) ){
00418 #ifdef PGMCOMOUT
00419                 case MT_STREAM:
00420                         if ( device->m_dpd.streaming_enabled ){
00421                                 dbg(1,  " MT_STREAM:\n" );
00422                                 streamPut( &device->downstreambuf, mfa );
00423 // user code dQ's data
00424                                 wake_up_interruptible( &device->m_dpd.waitq ); 
00425                                 return;
00426                         }else{
00427                                 break;
00428                         }
00429 #endif
00430                 case MT_COMMAND_PACKET:
00431                         acq200_processCommandMessageReturn( device, message );
00432                         break;
00433                 default:
00434                         dbg(1,  " default: id 0x%08x\n", 
00435                             MT_ID(message->header.type) );
00436 
00437             
00438                         if ( device->m_dpd.aux_task_waiting ){
00439                                 device->m_dpd.aux_mfa = mfa;
00440                                 device->m_dpd.aux_task_waiting = 0;    
00441 // no race, rather discard
00442                                 wake_up_interruptible(&device->m_dpd.aux_waitq);
00443                                 return;
00444                         }else{
00445                                 device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_discarded++;
00446                                 dbg(1,  "discard %x\n", mfa );
00447                         }
00448                 }
00449                 i2o_return_message( device, mfa );              
00450         }
00451 }
00452

00454 
00455 
00456 void acq200_consume_i2o(struct Acq200Device* device, u32 mfa )
00457 {
00458         dbg(4, " OUTBOUND FIFO 0x%08x\n", mfa );
00459 
00460         device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_incoming++;
00461 
00462         if (acq200_debug == 8){
00463                 dbg(2,  "SHORT CIRCUIT\n" );
00464                 i2o_return_message( device, mfa );
00465         }else if ( streamPut( &device->streambuf, mfa ) < 0 ){
00466                 i2o_return_message( device, mfa );
00467                 device->m_dpd.i2o_packets_discarded++;
00468                 dbg(2, " discarding buffer  0x%08x\n", mfa );
00469 
00470                 TIMESTAMP( device, 'i', "disc" );
00471         }else{
00472                 device->m_dpd.i2o_last_in = (void*)(unsigned long)mfa;
00473 
00474 #ifdef PGMCOMOUT
00475                 device->m_dpd.streaming_message_delta_usecs =
00476                         acq32_getDeltaTime( 
00477                                 &device->m_dpd.tv_last_streaming_message,
00478                                 &device->m_dpd.tv_last_streaming_message  );
00479 #endif
00480                 TIMESTAMP( device, 'i', "put" );
00481 
00482                 dbg(4, " queued mfa 0x%08x\n", mfa );
00483 
00484                 tasklet_schedule(&device->m_dpd.streaming_isr_tasklet);            
00485                         
00486                 dbg(5, " queue_task acq200_streaming_isr_bh");
00487         }
00488 }
00489 
00490 static void i2o_handleLastMessage(
00491         struct ReturnCommandHandler* self,
00492         struct MESSAGE* response
00493         )
00494 {
00495         self->rchReturn.valid = 1;
00496         wake_up_interruptible(&self->path->return_waitq);
00497         i2o_recycleRch(self);
00498 }
00499 
00500 
00501 ssize_t acq200_bridge_read_generic (
00502         struct file* file, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* posp,
00503         int hrd_code,
00504         struct IoMapping *kbuf)
00505 {
00506         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00507         struct ReturnCommandHandler* rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00508         Message *message;
00509         unsigned pam;
00510         unsigned rch_flags = RCH_KB_POOL;
00511 
00512         if (rch == 0){
00513                 return -ETIMEDOUT;
00514         }
00515 
00516         if (kbuf == 0){
00517                 kbuf = acq200_pool_alloc_mapping(
00518                                 device, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);    
00519                 if (kbuf == 0){
00520                         i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00521                         return -ETIMEDOUT;
00522                 }
00523                 pam = MK_DMABUF_OFFSET(kbuf, device);
00524         }else{
00525                 pam = kbuf->pa;
00526                 rch_flags = 0;
00527         }
00528 
00529         if (kbuf->len == 0){
00530                 i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00531                 acq200_pool_free_mapping(device, kbuf);
00532                 return -ENOMEM;
00533         }else{
00534                 count = min(count, (size_t)kbuf->len);
00535         }
00536 
00537 
00538 
00539         message = build_incoming_raw_message(
00540                         file, pam, *posp, count, hrd_code);
00541 
00542         buildRch(rch, i2o_handleReadMessageFile, PD(file), kbuf, rch_flags);
00543 
00544         dbg(1, "build count %u rch %p kbuf %p", 
00545             (unsigned)count, rch,  rch->rchReturn.kbuf);
00546 
00547         rchAppend(&device->m_dpd.rch.list, rch);
00548         acq200_sendI2O_kbuf(PD(file), message); 
00549 
00550         wait_event_interruptible(
00551                 PD(file)->return_waitq, rch->rchReturn.valid != 0);
00552 
00553         dbg(1, "rch %p valid %d", rch, rch->rchReturn.valid);
00554 
00555         switch(rchRemoveIfNotValid(rch)){
00556         case 1:
00557                 count = (size_t)rch->rchReturn.nbytes;
00558                 break;
00559         case 0:
00560                 dbg(1, "return -EINTR rch %p kbuf %p", 
00561                         rch, rch->rchReturn.kbuf);
00562                 /* leave ISR to recycle the buffer when/if it comes */
00563                 return -EINTR;
00564         default:
00565                 i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00566                 return -EFAULT;
00567         }
00568 
00569         dbg(1,"copy to user va:%p pa:0x%08lx count:%u",
00570             kbuf->va, kbuf->pa, (unsigned)count );
00571 
00572         dma_sync_single(&device->pci_dev->dev,
00573                         rch->rchReturn.kbuf->pa,
00574                         count,
00575                         DMA_FROM_DEVICE);
00576 
00577         acq200_copy_from_io_to_user(file, buf, rch->rchReturn.kbuf->va, count);
00578         *posp += count;
00579         i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00580         
00581         dbg(1, "return %u", (unsigned)count);
00582         return count;   
00583 }
00584 
00585 ssize_t acq200_bridge_write_generic (
00586         struct file *file, const char *buf, size_t count, loff_t * posp,
00587         int hrd_code)
00588 // write data as if from debug port
00589 {       
00590         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00591         struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00592         struct IoMapping *kbuf;
00593         Message *message;
00594         unsigned pam;
00595         unsigned rch_flags = RCH_KB_POOL;
00596         if (rch == 0) return -ETIMEDOUT;
00597 
00598         kbuf = acq200_pool_alloc_mapping(device, PCI_DMA_TODEVICE);
00599         if (kbuf == 0){ 
00600                 i2o_recycleRch(rch);
00601                 return -ETIMEDOUT;
00602         }
00603         pam = MK_DMABUF_OFFSET(kbuf, device);
00604 
00605         count = min(count, (size_t)kbuf->len);
00606 
00607         if (count == 0) return -ENOMEM;
00608 
00609 
00610         acq200_copy_from_user_to_io(file, kbuf->va, buf, count);
00611         
00612         message = build_outgoing_raw_message( 
00613                 file, pam, *posp, count, hrd_code);
00614 
00615         dma_sync_single(&device->pci_dev->dev,
00616                         device->dma_buf.pa,
00617                         count,
00618                         DMA_TO_DEVICE);
00619 
00620         buildRch(rch, i2o_recycleRchWrapper, PD(file), kbuf, rch_flags);
00621 
00622         dbg(1,"rch %p kbuf %p mbuf %08x", 
00623             rch, rch->rchReturn.kbuf, message->payload.hrdr[0].pci );
00624 
00625         rchAppend(&device->m_dpd.rch.list, rch);
00626         acq200_sendI2O_kbuf(PD(file), message);
00627 
00628 /*
00629  * and then? - WORKTODO: need to recycle kbuf
00630  */     
00631         *posp += count;
00632 
00633         dbg(1, "99 returning %u", (unsigned)count);
00634         return count;   
00635 }
00636 
00637 ssize_t acq200_bridge_write (
00638         struct file *file, const char *buf, size_t count, loff_t * posp)
00639 // write data as if from debug port
00640 {       
00641         dbg(1, "count %d", (int)count);
00642 
00643         return acq200_bridge_write_generic (
00644                 file, buf, count, posp, HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE );
00645 }
00646 
00647 ssize_t acq200_bridge_read (
00648         struct file* file, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* posp)
00649 {
00650         return acq200_bridge_read_generic(
00651                 file, buf, count, posp, HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE, USE_POOL);
00652 }
00653 
00654 ssize_t acq200_bridge_readAB (
00655         struct file* file, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* posp)
00656 {
00657         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00658         struct IoMapping mapping;
00659         /* @todo do the AB toggle thing */
00660         struct DmaBuf *dma_buf = &device->AB[0];
00661         
00662         mapping.va = dma_buf->va;
00663         mapping.pa = dma_buf->pa;
00664         mapping.len = dma_buf_len(dma_buf);
00665 
00666         dbg(1, "count %d buffer pa 0x%08lx", (int)count, mapping.pa);
00667 
00668         return acq200_bridge_read_generic(
00669                 file, buf, count, posp, 
00670                         HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE|HRD_ABS_PCI, &mapping);
00671 }
00672 
00673 void _recycle(struct Acq200Path *path, int ibuf)
00674 {
00675         dbg(1, "buffer%c", ibuf? 'B': 'A');
00676 
00677         if (path->rchAB[ibuf]){
00678                 i2o_recycleRch(path->rchAB[ibuf]);      
00679                 path->rchAB[ibuf] = 0;
00680         }
00681 }
00682 
00683 void acq200_bufferABrecycle(struct file *file, struct BufferAB_Ops *ops)
00684 {
00685         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00686 
00687         if (ops->ci.recycle&BUFFER_A_FLAG){
00688                 _recycle(path, BUFFERA);
00689         }
00690         if (ops->ci.recycle&BUFFER_B_FLAG){
00691                 _recycle(path, BUFFERB);
00692         }
00693 }
00694 
00695 static int fillDeviceStatus(
00696         struct BufferAB_Ops *ops, struct Acq200Path *path)
00697 {
00698         int buffer = path->ab_next;
00699         struct RchReturn* rr = &path->rchAB[buffer]->rchReturn;
00700 
00701         dbg(2, "buffer%c", buffer? 'B': 'A');
00702 
00703         if (rr->valid){         
00704                 dma_sync_single(
00705                         &path->device->pci_dev->dev, rr->kbuf->pa,
00706                         rr->nbytes, DMA_FROM_DEVICE
00707                 );
00708                 ops->ds.full |= BUFFER_FLAG_LUT[buffer];
00709                 ops->ds.sid[path->ab_next] = rr->start_id;
00710                 ops->ds.len[path->ab_next] = rr->nbytes;
00711                 if (rr->nbytes == 0){
00712                         ops->ds.full |= FULL_EOF;
00713                 }
00714                 path->ab_next = buffer == BUFFERA? BUFFERB: BUFFERA;
00715                 return 1;
00716         }else{
00717                 return 0;
00718         }
00719 }
00720 
00721 static void acq200_bufferAB_queue(struct file *file, int buffer)
00722 {
00723         struct Acq200Path *path =PD(file);
00724         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00725         struct ReturnCommandHandler* rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00726         struct DmaBuf *dma_buf = &device->AB[buffer];
00727         struct IoMapping mapping;
00728         Message *message;
00729 
00730         dbg(2, "01 buffer%c", buffer? 'B': 'A');
00731 
00732         path->rchAB[buffer] = rch;
00733 
00734         mapping.va = dma_buf->va;
00735         mapping.pa = dma_buf->pa;
00736         mapping.len = dma_buf_len(dma_buf);
00737 
00738         message = build_hrd_message(
00739                 file, mapping.pa, path->sid++, mapping.len/2,
00740                 1, LDH_INBOUND,
00741                 HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE|HRD_ABS_PCI|HRD_READ_NEXT);
00742         
00743         buildRch(rch, i2o_handleReadMessageFile, PD(file), 
00744                  &path->bufferMappings[buffer], !RCH_KB_POOL);
00745         rchAppend(&device->m_dpd.rch.list, rch);
00746 
00747         dbg(2, "acq200_sendI2O_kbuf %p", message);
00748 
00749         acq200_sendI2O_kbuf(PD(file), message); 
00750 }
00751 
00752 int i2o_missed_int_checker(void *arg)
00753 {       
00754         struct Acq200Device *device = (struct Acq200Device*)arg;
00755         wait_queue_head_t waitq;
00756 
00757         init_waitqueue_head(&waitq);
00758 
00759         while(!kthread_should_stop()){
00760                 int timeout = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
00761                         waitq, 0, I2O_RETRY(device));
00762                 if (timeout != 0){
00763                         break;
00764                 }else{
00765                         static int msgn;
00766                         int rc = acq200_handle_incoming_message(device);
00767 
00768                         ++msgn;
00769                         if (rc == 1){
00770                                 info("%d backstop handled lost irq %d", 
00771                                      device->idx, msgn);
00772                         }else{
00773                                 if ((msgn&0x1f) == 0){
00774                                         dbg(1, "backstop idle %d", msgn);
00775                                 }
00776                         }
00777                 }
00778         }
00779         return 0;
00780 }
00781 
00782 int acq200_bufferABaction(struct file *file, struct BufferAB_Ops *ops)
00783 {
00784         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00785         
00786         int rc;
00787 
00788         acq200_bufferABrecycle(file, ops);
00789 
00790         if (path->rchAB[BUFFERA] == 0){
00791                 acq200_bufferAB_queue(file, BUFFERA);
00792         }
00793         if (path->rchAB[BUFFERB] == 0){
00794                 acq200_bufferAB_queue(file, BUFFERB);
00795         }
00796 
00797         dbg(2, "wait valid %d timeout %d",
00798                 path->rchAB[path->ab_next]->rchReturn.valid,
00799                 ops->ci.timeout);
00800 
00801         
00802 
00803         rc = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
00804                 PD(file)->return_waitq, 
00805                 path->rchAB[path->ab_next]->rchReturn.valid != 0,
00806                 ops->ci.timeout);
00807 
00808 
00809         dbg(2, "wait done %s", rc==0? "TIMEOUT": rc<0? "ERROR": "OK");
00810         
00811         if (rc == 0){
00812                 err("TIMEDOUT");
00813                 return -ETIMEDOUT;
00814         }else if (rc < 0){
00815                 err("rc:%d", rc);
00816                 return rc;
00817         }
00818 
00819         ops->ds.full = 0;
00820         
00821         if (fillDeviceStatus(ops, path)){
00822                 fillDeviceStatus(ops, path);
00823         }
00824         
00825         return 0;
00826 }
00827 
00828 
00829 static void _cleanup_on_bridge_release(struct Acq200Path *path)
00830 {
00831         struct Acq200Device *device = path->device;
00832         struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch_cursor;
00833 
00834 cleanup:
00835         list_for_each_entry(rch_cursor, &device->m_dpd.rch.list, list){
00836                 dbg(2, "path %p want %p rch %p kbuf %p",
00837                             rch_cursor->path, path, rch_cursor, 
00838                             rch_cursor->rchReturn.kbuf);         
00839 
00840                 if (rch_cursor->path == path){
00841                         dbg(1, "WARNING: last chance to recycle %d",
00842                             rch_cursor->command_id);
00843                         i2o_recycleRch(rch_cursor);
00844                         goto cleanup;                   
00845                 }
00846         }
00847 }
00848 
00849 static int acq200_bridge_release_message(
00850         struct inode *inode, 
00851         struct file *file,
00852         Message *message
00853 )
00854 {
00855         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00856         struct Acq200Device *device = path->device;
00857         struct ReturnCommandHandler *my_rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00858 
00859         while(my_rch == 0){
00860                 err("null rch. RETRY");
00861                 my_rch = acq200_pool_alloc_rch(device);
00862         }
00863 
00864         buildRch(my_rch, i2o_handleLastMessage, path, 0, RCH_KB_POOL);
00865         rchAppend(&device->m_dpd.rch.list, my_rch);     
00866 
00867         acq200_sendI2O_kbuf(path, message);
00868 
00869         wait_event_interruptible(path->return_waitq, 
00870                                  my_rch->rchReturn.valid != 0);
00871 
00872         dbg(1, "done waiting valid: %d", my_rch->rchReturn.valid);
00873 
00874         if (my_rch->rchReturn.valid == 1){
00875                 i2o_recycleRch(my_rch);
00876         }
00877         /* this to free any trapped rch */
00878         _cleanup_on_bridge_release(path);
00879 
00880         return acq200_release(inode, file);
00881 }
00882 
00883 int acq200_bridge_release_generic (
00884         struct inode *inode, struct file *file, int hrd_code
00885 )
00886 {
00887         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00888         
00889         dbg(2, "path->last_direction_hack %d", path->last_direction_hack);
00890 
00891         switch(path->last_direction_hack){
00892         case LDH_OUTBOUND:
00893                 return acq200_bridge_release_message(
00894                         inode, file,
00895                         build_outgoing_raw_message(
00896                                 file, 0, 0, 0, hrd_code|HRD_CHAN_EOF));
00897         case LDH_INBOUND:
00898                 return acq200_bridge_release_message(
00899                         inode, file,
00900                         build_incoming_raw_message(
00901                                 file, 0, 0, 0, hrd_code|HRD_CHAN_EOF));
00902         default:
00903                 _cleanup_on_bridge_release(path);
00904                 return acq200_release(inode, file);
00905         }
00906 }
00907 
00908 int acq200_bridge_release (
00909         struct inode *inode, struct file *file
00910         )
00911 {
00912         return acq200_bridge_release_generic(
00913                 inode, file, HRD_CHAN_IS_FILE );
00914 }
00915 
00916 
00917 void rchInit(struct Acq200Device* device, struct ReturnCommandHandler *rch)
00918 {
00919         if (rch == 0){
00920                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&device->m_dpd.rch.list);
00921                 spin_lock_init(&device->m_dpd.rch.lock);
00922         }else{
00923                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rch->list);
00924                 rch->handler = NULL;
00925                 rch->lock = &device->m_dpd.rch.lock;
00926         }
00927 }
